item.title: I obtained my PhD
item.description: I obtained my PhD from Universite de Montreal! My dissertation received a (letter) grade of “exceptional”, and was nominated to the Dean’s honor list and the best thesis award!

item.title: Serving as virtual chair for ICLR 2022
item.description: I will serve as a virtual co-chair for ICLR 2022.

item.title: Serving as associate editor for IROS 2022
item.description: I will serve as an associate editor for the IEEE international conference on intelligent robots and systems, 2022.

item.title: Moving to MIT for a postdoc
item.description: In early 2022, I will move to MIT as a postdoctoral associate, working closely with Josh Tenenbaum and Antonio Torralba’s groups.

item.title: Teaching a new class on ML + Graphics
item.description: Teaching the realistic/advanced image synthesis class at McGill university for the Fall semester, 2021.

item.title: Workshops at ICCV and Neurips 2021
item.description: Co-organizing the Differentiable 3D Vision and Graphics workshop at ICCV 2021, and the Physical Reasoning and Inductive Biases for the Real World workshop at Neurips 2021.

item.title: Awarded a Google PhD fellowship (declined)
item.description: Extremely honored to be awarded a Google PhD fellowship for “Machine Perception, Speech Technology, and Computer Vision” for 2021. Thank you Google, for this coveted recognition!

item.title: ICLR workshop on rethinking scientific paper formats
item.description: We are organizing a (virtual) workshop at ICLR 2021: Beyond the research paper - rethinking how we share scientific understanding in ML research, to reflect on formats for scientific publishing geared towards accessibility, pedagogy, and reproducibility. See https://rethinkingmlpapers.github.io for more details!

item.title: Awarded an NVIDIA graduate fellowship
item.description: Honored and excited to have received an NVIDIA graduate fellowship for 2021-22.

item.title: gradslam - library available!
item.description: gradslam is available as an open-source pytorch framework here

item.title: Organizing a robot learning seminar series
item.description: We are organizing a (virtual) seminar series on robot learning at Mila and the Robotics and Embodied AI Lab. Visit our seminar page for more.

item.title: Neurips workshop on differentiable vision, graphics, physics
item.description: We are organizing a (virtual) workshop at Neurips 2020 on differentiable computer vision, graphics, and physics in ML, with a star-studded speaker lineup! Visit our workshop webpage for more.

item.title: Selected to the "RSS pioneers" 2020 cohort
item.description: Honoured to be part of the RSS pioneers cohort of 2020 announced, with 27 other amazing grad students and postdocs. Check out a short video abstract of my near-term research.

item.title: Maplite awarded "Best Robotics and Automation Letters paper of 2019"
item.description: Honoured to be announced best paper of RAL, 2019, at the awards ceremony at ICRA 2020.

item.title: gradSLAM is accepted to ICRA 2020
item.description: Our paper on fully differentiable dense SLAM will be (virtually) presented at ICRA 2020

item.title: MonoLayout presented at WACV 2020.
item.description: Our paper Monolayout, tackling amodal scene layout estimation from a single image, was presented at WACV 2020. For more details, visit our GitHub repo, or watch this video abstract.

item.title: Maplite accepted to RAL; will be presented at ICRA 2020.
item.description: Our paper MapLite, tackling autonomous rural intersection navigation without a detailed prior map, is accepted for publication in Robotics and Automation Letters. It will also be presented at the International Conference on Robotics and Automation (ICRA) 2020.

item.title: Excited to launch Kaolin- a 3D deep learning library for PyTorch users
item.description: During a summer internship at NVIDIA, Toronto, I worked with Prof. Sanja Fidler’s group to build Kaolin: a 3D deep learning framework for PyTorch users.
